010package imagingbook.pub.sift;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.mod;
013import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
014
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016import java.util.Collections;
017import java.util.List;
018
019import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
020import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
021import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
022import imagingbook.pub.sift.scalespace.DogScaleSpace;
023import imagingbook.pub.sift.scalespace.GaussianScaleSpace;
024import imagingbook.pub.sift.scalespace.ScaleLevel;
025import imagingbook.pub.sift.scalespace.ScaleOctave;
026
027public class SiftDetector {
028
029        /* Default parameters; a (usually modified) instance of this class
030         * may be passed to constructor of the main class.
031         */
032        public static class Parameters {
033                /** Set true to output debug information */
034                public boolean DEBUG = false;
035                /** Type of neigborhood used for peak detection in 3D scale space */
036                public NeighborhoodType nhType = NeighborhoodType.NH18;
037                /** Sampling scale (nominal smoothing level of the input image) */
038                public double sigma_s = 0.5;
039                /** Base scale of level 0 (base smoothing) */
040                public double sigma_0 = 1.6;
041                /** Number of octaves in Gaussian/DoG scale space */
042                public int P = 4;
043                /** Scale steps (levels) per octave */
044                public int Q = 3;
045                /** Min. magnitude required in DoG peak detection (abs. value) */
046                public double t_Mag = 0.01;
047                /** Min. DoG magnitude required for extrapolated peaks (abs. value) */
048                public double t_Peak = t_Mag;
049                /** Min. difference to all neighbors in DoG peak detection (max. 0.0005) */
050                public double t_Extrm = 0.0;
051                /** Max. number of iterations for refining the position of a key point */
052                public int n_Refine = 5;
053                /** Max. principal curvature ratio used to eliminate line-like structures (3..10) */
054                public double rho_Max = 10.0;
055                /** Number of orientation bins in the feature descriptor (angular resolution) */
056                public int n_Orient = 36;
057                /** Number of smoothing steps applied to the orientation histogram */
058                public int n_Smooth = 2;
059                /** Min. value in orientation histogram for dominant orientations (rel. to max. entry) */
060                public double t_DomOr = 0.8;
061                /** Spatial size factor of descriptor (relative to feature scale) */
062                public double s_Desc = 10.0;
063                /** Number of spatial descriptor bins along each x/y axis */
064                public int n_Spat = 4;
065                /** Number of angular descriptor bins */
066                public int n_Angl = 8;
067                /** Max. value in normalized feature vector (0.2 recommended by Lowe) */
068                public double t_Fclip = 0.2;
069                /** Scale factor for converting normalized features to byte values in [0,255] */
070                public double s_Fscale = 512.0;
071                /** Set true to sort detected keypoints by response magnitude */
072                public boolean sortKeyPoints = true;
073        }
074        
075        private final Parameters params;
076
077        /**
078         * Types of 3D neighborhoods used in min/max detection 
079         */
080        public enum NeighborhoodType {
081                NH8(8), NH10(10), NH18(18), NH26(26);
082                private final int size;
083                private NeighborhoodType(int size) {
084                        this.size = size;
085                }
086        }
087        
088        static private final double PI2 = 2 * Math.PI;
089
090        /* non-static/final fields */
091
092        private final int nhSize;
093        private final GaussianScaleSpace G;
094        private final DogScaleSpace D;
095
096        /* Constructors */
097
098        public SiftDetector(FloatProcessor fp) {
099                this(fp, new Parameters());     // uses default parameters
100        }
101
102        public SiftDetector(FloatProcessor fp, Parameters params) {
103                //normalize(fp);        // was destructive, delegated to ScaleLevel.getValues()
104                this.params = params;
105                this.nhSize = params.nhType.size;
106                this.G = new GaussianScaleSpace(fp, params.sigma_s, params.sigma_0, params.P, params.Q, -1, params.Q+1);
107                this.D = new DogScaleSpace(G);
108        }
109
110        /**
111         * Only used for debugging: produces key points with orientation
112         * histograms attached for display purposes.
113         * 
114         * @param keypoints the sequence of original key points
115         * @return a sequence of enhanced key points
116         */
117        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
118        private  List<KeyPoint> makeRichKeypoints(List<KeyPoint> keypoints) {
119//              if (params.DEBUG) {IJ.log("makeSiftDescriptors...");}
120                //int cnt = 0;
121                List<KeyPoint> richKeyPoints = new ArrayList<KeyPoint>();
122                for (KeyPoint kp : keypoints) {
123                        //IJ.log("   " + (cnt++));
124                        float[] oh = getOrientationHistogram(kp);
125                        smoothCircular(oh,params.n_Smooth);
126                        kp.orientation_histogram = oh;  // TODO: remove, for testing only!!
127                        List<Double> peakOrientations = findPeakOrientationIndices(oh);
128//                      if (params.DEBUG && peakOrientations.size() == 0) {
129//                              IJ.log("insufficient orientations at " + kp.u + "/" + kp.v);
130//                      }
131                        for (double km : peakOrientations) {
132                                //for (int i=0; i<Math.min(1, peakOrientations.length); i++) {  // use only 1 descriptor!
133                                float phi = (float) (km * 2 * Math.PI / oh.length);     // 0 <= phi < 2 PI. Should be in range +/-PI?
134                                KeyPoint rkp = (KeyPoint) kp.clone();
135                                rkp.orientation = phi;
136                                richKeyPoints.add(rkp);
137                        }
138                }
139//              if (params.DEBUG) {IJ.log("makeSiftDescriptors...done");}
140                return richKeyPoints;
141        }
142
143        /**
144         * Used for debugging/illustrations only!
145         * 
146         * @param oh orientation histogram
147         * @return list of histogram indices for the peak orientations
148         */
149        private List<Double> findPeakOrientationIndices(float[] oh) {
150                int nb = oh.length;
151                List<Double> orientIndexes = new ArrayList<Double>(nb);
152                // find the maximum entry in the orientation histogram 'oh'
153                float maxh = oh[0];
154                for (int k = 1; k < nb; k++) {
155                        if (oh[k] > maxh)
156                                maxh = oh[k];
157                }
158
159                if (maxh > 0.01f) { // ascertain minimum (non-zero) gradient energy
160                        // collect all peaks > 80% of the maximum entry in 'oh'
161                        float minh = maxh * (float) params.t_DomOr;
162                        for (int k = 0; k < nb; k++) { // hp ~ hc ~ ha
163                                // angles[k] = Float.NaN;
164                                float hc = oh[k]; // center value
165                                if (oh[k] > minh) { // value is min. 80% of global peak
166                                        float hp = oh[(k - 1 + nb) % nb]; // previous histogram
167                                        // value
168                                        float hn = oh[(k + 1) % nb]; // next histogram value
169                                        if (hc > hp && hc > hn) { // check if 'hc' is a local peak
170                                                // interpolate orientation by a quadratic function
171                                                // (parabola):
172                                                double delta = interpolateQuadratic(hp, hc, hn);
173                                                double k_max = (k + delta + nb) % nb; // interpolated
174                                                // bin index, 0
175                                                // <= km < nPhi
176                                                // double phi_max = k_max * 2 * Math.PI / nb; // 0 <=
177                                                // phi < 2 PI. Should be in range +/-PI?
178                                                orientIndexes.add(k_max);
179                                        }
180                                }
181                        }
182                }
183                return orientIndexes;
184        }
185
186
187        /**
188         * THE REAL STUFF: Creating the SIFT Descriptors
189         * 
190         * @return the sequence of extracted SIFT descriptors
191         */
192        public List<SiftDescriptor> getSiftFeatures() {
193                List<KeyPoint> keyPoints = getKeyPoints();
194                List<SiftDescriptor> siftDescriptors = new ArrayList<SiftDescriptor>();
195                for (KeyPoint c : keyPoints) {
196                        for (double phi_d : getDominantOrientations(c)) {
197                                SiftDescriptor sd = makeSiftDescriptor(c, phi_d);
198                                if (sd != null) {
199                                        siftDescriptors.add(sd);
200                                }
201                        }
202                }
203                return siftDescriptors;
204        }
205
206        private List<KeyPoint> getKeyPoints() {
207                List<KeyPoint> keyPts = new ArrayList<KeyPoint>();
208                final int P = params.P;
209                final int K = params.Q;
210                for (int p = 0; p <= P-1; p++) {        // for every octave p
211                        for (int q = 0; q <= K-1; q++) {        // for every scale level q
212                                List<KeyPoint> extrema = findExtrema(p, q);
213                                for (KeyPoint e : extrema) {
214                                        KeyPoint c = refineKeyPosition(D, e);
215                                        if (c != null) {
216                                                keyPts.add(c);
217                                        }
218                                }
219                        }
220                }
221                if (params.sortKeyPoints) {
222                        Collections.sort(keyPts);
223                }
224                return keyPts;
225        }
226
227        private List<KeyPoint> findExtrema(int p, int q) {
228                final float tMag = (float) params.t_Mag;
229                final float tExtrm = (float) params.t_Extrm;
230                ScaleOctave Dp = D.getOctave(p);
231                ScaleLevel Dpq = D.getScaleLevel(p, q);
232                int M = Dpq.getWidth();
233                int N = Dpq.getHeight();
234                List<KeyPoint> E = new ArrayList<KeyPoint>();
235                float scale = (float) D.getAbsoluteScale(p, q); //D.getScaleIndexFloat(p, q); needed?
236
237                final float[][][] nh = new float[3][3][3];      // 3x3x3 neighborhood [q][u][v]
238                for (int u = 1; u <= M-2; u++) {
239                        float x_real = (float) D.getRealX(p, u);        // for display purposes only
240                        for (int v = 1; v <= N-2; v++) {
241                                float y_real = (float) D.getRealY(p, v);        // for display purposes only
242                                float mag = Math.abs(Dpq.getf(u, v));
243                                if (mag > tMag) {
244                                        Dp.getNeighborhood(q, u, v, nh);        // CHANGE to use D not Dp!!
245                                        if (isExtremum(nh, tExtrm)) {
246                                                KeyPoint e = new KeyPoint(p, q, u, v, u, v, x_real, y_real, scale, mag);
247                                                E.add(e);
248                                        }
249                                }
250                        }
251                }
252                return E;
253        }
254
255        private KeyPoint refineKeyPosition(DogScaleSpace D, KeyPoint k) { 
256                //IJ.log("++Processing " + c.toString());
257                final int p = k.p;
258                final int q = k.q;
259                int u = k.u;
260                int v = k.v;
261                ScaleOctave Dp = D.getOctave(p);
262                //ScaleLevel Dpq = Dp.getLevel(q);
263
264                final double rhoMax = params.rho_Max;
265
266                final float[][][] nh = new float[3][3][3];      // 3x3x3 neighborhood nh[q][u][v]
267                final float[] grad       = new float[3];                // gradient (dx, dy, ds)        
268                final float[] d          = new float[3];                // relocation displacement (dx, dy, ds)
269                final float[][] hess = new float[3][3];         // 3D Hessian matrix:
270                                                                                                        // | dxx dxy dxs |
271                                                                                                        // | dxy dyy dys |
272                                                                                                        // | dxs dys dss |
273                final double tPeak = params.t_Peak;
274                final int n_max = params.n_Refine;
275
276                final float aMax = (float) (sqr(rhoMax + 1) / rhoMax);
277                KeyPoint kr = null;                                                     // refined keypoint
278                boolean done = false;
279                int n = 1;
280                while (!done && n <= n_max && Dp.isInside(q, u, v)) {
281                        Dp.getNeighborhood(q, u, v, nh);        // TODO: CHANGE to use D instead of Dp!
282                        gradient(nh, grad);                                     // result stored in grad
283                        hessian(nh, hess);                                      // result stored in hess
284                        final double detH = Matrix.determinant3x3(hess);
285                        if (Arithmetic.isZero(detH)) {  // Hessian matrix has zero determinant?
286                                done = true;    // ignore this point and finish
287                        }
288                        else {
289                                final float dxx = hess[0][0];   // extract 2x2 Hessian for calculating curvature ratio below
290                                final float dxy = hess[0][1];
291                                final float dyy = hess[1][1];
292//                              final float[][] invHess = Matrix.inverse3x3(hess);      // deprecated
293                                final float[][] invHess = Matrix.inverse(hess);         // alternative (numerically stable)
294                                Matrix.multiplyD(invHess, grad, d);     // d <-- invHess . grad
295                                Matrix.multiplyD(-1, d);                        // d <-- - d
296                                final float xx = d[0];  // = x'
297                                final float yy = d[1];  // = y'
298
299                                if (Math.abs(xx) < 0.5f && Math.abs(yy) < 0.5f) {       // stay at this lattice point
300                                        done = true;
301                                        final float Dpeak = nh[1][1][1] + 0.5f * (grad[0]*xx + grad[1]*yy + grad[2]*d[2]);
302                                        final float detHxy = dxx * dyy - dxy * dxy;
303                                        if (Math.abs(Dpeak) > tPeak && detHxy > 0) { // check peak magnitude
304                                                final float a = sqr(dxx + dyy) / detHxy;
305                                                if (a <= aMax) {                                        // check curvature ratio (edgeness)
306//                                                      if (params.DEBUG) IJ.log(k.toString() + String.format(": added after %d tries, alpha = %f", n, a));
307                                                        kr = k; //  the passed keypoint is reused for the refined keypoint, with p,q,u,v unchanged
308                                                        kr.x = u + xx;
309                                                        kr.y = v + yy;
310                                                        kr.x_real = (float) D.getRealX(p, kr.x);
311                                                        kr.y_real = (float) D.getRealY(p, kr.y);
312                                                        kr.scale  = (float) D.getAbsoluteScale(p, q);
313                                                }
314                                        }
315                                }
316                                else { // large displacement, move to a neighboring DoG cell at same level q by at most one unit
317                                        u = u + Math.min(1, Math.max(-1, Math.round(xx)));      // move u by max +/-1
318                                        v = v + Math.min(1, Math.max(-1, Math.round(yy)));      // move v by max +/-1
319                                        // Note: we don't move along the scale axis!
320                                }
321                        }
322                        n = n + 1;
323                }
324                return kr;
325        }
326
327        private boolean isExtremum(float[][][] nh, float tExtrm) {
328                return isLocalMin(nh, tExtrm) || isLocalMax(nh, tExtrm);
329        }
330
331        private boolean isLocalMin(final float[][][] neighborhood, float tExtrm) {
332                final float c = neighborhood[1][1][1] + tExtrm; // center value + threshold
333                if (c >= 0) return false;       // local minimum must have a negative value
334                // check 8 neighbors in scale plane q
335                if (c >= neighborhood[1][0][0]) return false;
336                if (c >= neighborhood[1][1][0]) return false;
337                if (c >= neighborhood[1][2][0]) return false;
338                if (c >= neighborhood[1][0][1]) return false;
339                if (c >= neighborhood[1][2][1]) return false;
340                if (c >= neighborhood[1][0][2]) return false;
341                if (c >= neighborhood[1][1][2]) return false;
342                if (c >= neighborhood[1][2][2]) return false;
343                if (nhSize >= 10) {
344                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][1][1]) return false;
345                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][1][1]) return false;
346                        if (nhSize >= 18) {
347                                // check 4 more neighbors in scale plane q-1
348                                if (c >= neighborhood[0][0][1]) return false;
349                                if (c >= neighborhood[0][2][1]) return false;
350                                if (c >= neighborhood[0][1][0]) return false;
351                                if (c >= neighborhood[0][1][2]) return false;
352                                // check 4 more neighbors in scale plane q+1
353                                if (c >= neighborhood[2][0][1]) return false;
354                                if (c >= neighborhood[2][2][1]) return false;
355                                if (c >= neighborhood[2][1][0]) return false;
356                                if (c >= neighborhood[2][1][2]) return false;
357                                // optionally check 8 remaining neighbors (corners of cube):
358                                if (nhSize >= 26) {
359                                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][0][0]) return false;
360                                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][2][0]) return false;
361                                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][0][2]) return false;
362                                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][2][2]) return false;
363                                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][0][0]) return false;
364                                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][2][0]) return false;
365                                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][0][2]) return false;
366                                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][2][2]) return false;
367                                }
368                        }
369                }
370                return true;
371        }
372
373        private boolean isLocalMax(final float[][][] neighborhood, float tExtrm) {
374                final float c = neighborhood[1][1][1] - tExtrm;         // center value - threshold
375                if (c <= 0) return false;       // local maximum must have a positive value
376                // check 8 neighbors in scale plane q
377                if (c <= neighborhood[1][0][0]) return false;
378                if (c <= neighborhood[1][1][0]) return false;
379                if (c <= neighborhood[1][2][0]) return false;
380                if (c <= neighborhood[1][0][1]) return false;
381                if (c <= neighborhood[1][2][1]) return false;
382                if (c <= neighborhood[1][0][2]) return false;
383                if (c <= neighborhood[1][1][2]) return false;
384                if (c <= neighborhood[1][2][2]) return false;
385                if (nhSize >= 10) {
386                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][1][1]) return false;
387                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][1][1]) return false;
388                        if (nhSize >= 18) {
389                                // check 4 more neighbors in scale plane q-1
390                                if (c <= neighborhood[0][0][1]) return false;
391                                if (c <= neighborhood[0][2][1]) return false;
392                                if (c <= neighborhood[0][1][0]) return false;
393                                if (c <= neighborhood[0][1][2]) return false;
394                                // check 4 more neighbors in scale plane q+1
395                                if (c <= neighborhood[2][0][1]) return false;
396                                if (c <= neighborhood[2][2][1]) return false;
397                                if (c <= neighborhood[2][1][0]) return false;
398                                if (c <= neighborhood[2][1][2]) return false;
399                                // optionally check 8 remaining neighbors (corners of cube):
400                                if (nhSize >= 26) {
401                                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][0][0]) return false;
402                                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][2][0]) return false;
403                                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][0][2]) return false;
404                                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][2][2]) return false;
405                                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][0][0]) return false;
406                                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][2][0]) return false;
407                                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][0][2]) return false;
408                                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][2][2]) return false;
409                                }
410                        }
411                }
412                return true;
413        }
414
415        /*
416         * Calculates the 3-dimensional gradient vector for the 3x3x3 neighborhood
417         * nh[s][x][y]. The result is stored in the supplied vector grad, to which a reference is 
418         * returned.
419         */
420        private float[] gradient(final float[][][] nh, final float[] grad) {
421                // Note: factor 0.5f not needed, kept for clarity.
422                grad[0] = 0.5f * (nh[1][2][1] - nh[1][0][1]);   // = dx
423                grad[1] = 0.5f * (nh[1][1][2] - nh[1][1][0]);   // = dy
424                grad[2] = 0.5f * (nh[2][1][1] - nh[0][1][1]);   // = ds
425                return grad;
426        }
427
428        /* 
429         * Calculates the 3x3 Hessian matrix for the 3x3x3 neighborhood nh[s][i][j],
430         * with scale index s and spatial indices i, j.
431         * The result is stored in the supplied array hess, to which a reference is 
432         * returned.
433         */
434        private float[][] hessian(final float[][][] nh, final float[][] hess) {
435                final float nh_111 = 2 * nh[1][1][1];
436                final float dxx = nh[1][0][1] - nh_111 + nh[1][2][1];
437                final float dyy = nh[1][1][0] - nh_111 + nh[1][1][2];
438                final float dss = nh[0][1][1] - nh_111 + nh[2][1][1];
439
440                final float dxy = (nh[1][2][2] - nh[1][0][2] - nh[1][2][0] + nh[1][0][0]) * 0.25f;
441                final float dxs = (nh[2][2][1] - nh[2][0][1] - nh[0][2][1] + nh[0][0][1]) * 0.25f;
442                final float dys = (nh[2][1][2] - nh[2][1][0] - nh[0][1][2] + nh[0][1][0]) * 0.25f;
443
444                hess[0][0] = dxx;  hess[0][1] = dxy;  hess[0][2] = dxs;
445                hess[1][0] = dxy;  hess[1][1] = dyy;  hess[1][2] = dys;
446                hess[2][0] = dxs;  hess[2][1] = dys;  hess[2][2] = dss;
447                return hess;
448        }
449
450        /*
451         * Returns a list of orientations (angles) for the keypoint c.
452         */
453        private List<Double> getDominantOrientations(KeyPoint c) {
454                float[] h_phi = getOrientationHistogram(c);
455                smoothCircular(h_phi, params.n_Smooth);
456                return findPeakOrientations(h_phi);
457        }
458
459        // Smoothes the array A in-place (i.e., destructively) in 'iterations' passes.
460        private void smoothCircular(float[] X, int n_iter) {
461                final float[] H = { 0.25f, 0.5f, 0.25f }; // filter kernel
462                final int n = X.length;
463                for (int i = 1; i <= n_iter; i++) {
464                        float s = X[0];
465                        float p = X[n - 1];
466                        for (int j = 0; j <= n - 2; j++) {
467                                float c = X[j];
468                                X[j] = H[0] * p + H[1] * X[j] + H[2] * X[j + 1];
469                                p = c;
470                        }
471                        X[n - 1] = H[0] * p + H[1] * X[n - 1] + H[2] * s;
472                }
473        }
474
475        /* 
476         * Extracts the peaks in the orientation histogram 'h_phi'
477         * and returns the corresponding angles in a (possibly empty) list. 
478         */
479        private List<Double> findPeakOrientations(float[] h_phi) {
480                int n = h_phi.length;
481                List<Double> angles = new ArrayList<Double>(n);
482                // find the maximum entry in the orientation histogram 'h_phi'
483                float h_max = h_phi[0];
484                for (int k = 1; k < n; k++) {
485                        if (h_phi[k] > h_max)
486                                h_max = h_phi[k];
487                }
488                if (h_max > 0.01f) {    // ascertain minimum (non-zero) gradient energy 
489                        // collect all peaks > 80% of the maximum entry in 'oh'
490                        float h_min = h_max * 0.8f;
491                        for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {   // hp ~ hc ~ ha
492                                float hc = h_phi[k];                                            // center value
493                                if (hc > h_min) {               // value is min. 80% of global peak
494                                        float hp = h_phi[(k - 1 + n) % n];      // previous histogram value
495                                        float hn = h_phi[(k + 1) % n];          // next histogram value
496                                        if (hc > hp && hc > hn) {                       // check if 'hc' is a local peak
497                                                // interpolate orientation by a quadratic function (parabola):
498                                                double delta = interpolateQuadratic(hp, hc, hn);
499                                                double k_max = (k + delta + n) % n;     // interpolated bin index, 0 <= km < nPhi
500                                                double phi_max = k_max * 2 * Math.PI / n;       // 0 <= phi < 2 PI. Should be in range +/-PI?
501                                                angles.add(phi_max);
502                                        }
503                                }
504                        }
505                }
506                return angles;
507        }
508
509        private float[] getOrientationHistogram(KeyPoint c) {
510                final int n_phi = params.n_Orient;
511                final int K = params.Q;
512
513                ScaleLevel Gpq = G.getScaleLevel(c.p, c.q);
514                final float[] h_phi = new float[n_phi]; // automatically initialized to zero
515                final int M = Gpq.getWidth(), N = Gpq.getHeight();
516                final double x = c.x, y = c.y;
517
518                final double sigma_w = 1.5 * params.sigma_0 * Math.pow(2,(double)c.q/K);
519                final double sigma_w22 = 2 * sigma_w * sigma_w;
520                final double r_w = Math.max(1, 2.5 * sigma_w);
521                final double r_w2 = r_w * r_w;
522
523                final int u_min = Math.max((int)Math.floor(x - r_w), 1);
524                final int u_max = Math.min((int)Math.ceil(x + r_w), M-2);
525                final int v_min = Math.max((int)Math.floor(y - r_w), 1);
526                final int v_max = Math.min((int)Math.ceil(y + r_w), N-2);
527
528                double[] gradPol = new double[2]; // gradient magnitude/orientation
529
530                for (int u = u_min; u <= u_max; u++) {
531                        double dx = u - x;                                      // distance to feature's center
532                        for (int v = v_min; v <= v_max; v++) {
533                                double dy = v - y;
534                                double r2 = dx * dx + dy * dy;  // squared distance from center
535                                if (r2 < r_w2) {                                // inside limiting circle
536                                        Gpq.getGradientPolar(u, v, gradPol);
537                                        double E = gradPol[0], phi = gradPol[1];                                // gradient magnitude/orientation
538                                        double wG = Math.exp(-(dx*dx + dy*dy)/sigma_w22);               // Gaussian weight
539                                        double z = E * wG;
540                                        double k_phi = n_phi * phi / (2 * Math.PI);                             // continuous histogram bin index
541                                        double alpha = k_phi - Math.floor(k_phi);                               // weight alpha
542                                        int k_0 = Math.floorMod((int)Math.floor(k_phi), n_phi); // lower histogram index
543                                        int k_1 = Math.floorMod(k_0 + 1, n_phi);                                                        // upper histogram index
544                                        h_phi[k_0] = (float) (h_phi[k_0] + (1 - alpha) * z);    // distribute z into bins k_0, k_1
545                                        h_phi[k_1] = (float) (h_phi[k_1] + alpha * z);
546                                }
547                        }
548                }
549                return h_phi;
550        }
551
552        private SiftDescriptor makeSiftDescriptor(KeyPoint c, double phi_d) {
553                final int p = c.p, q = c.q;
554                final double x = c.x, y = c.y;
555                final double mag = c.magnitude;
556
557                ScaleLevel Gpq = G.getScaleLevel(p, q);
558                final int M = Gpq.getWidth(), N = Gpq.getHeight(), K = G.getQ();
559
560                double sigma_q = G.getSigma_0() * Math.pow(2, (double) q / K);  // = Gpq.getAbsoluteScale() ?? decimated scale
561                double w_d = params.s_Desc * sigma_q;           // descriptor width
562                double sigma_d = 0.25 * w_d;    // width of Gaussian weighting function
563                double sigma_d2 = 2 * sigma_d * sigma_d;
564                double r_d = 2.5 * sigma_d;             // limiting radius
565                double r_d2 = r_d * r_d;                // squared limiting radius
566
567                double sc = 1.0/w_d;                                    // scale to canonical frame
568                double sin_phi_d = Math.sin(-phi_d);    // precalculated sine
569                double cos_phi_d = Math.cos(-phi_d);    // precalculated cosine
570
571                //              Debug(logvar(p,"p") + logvar(q,"q") + logvar(w_d,"w_d"));
572
573                int u_min = Math.max((int)Math.floor(x - r_d), 1);
574                int u_max = Math.min((int)Math.ceil(x + r_d), M - 2);
575                //              Debug(logvar(x,"x") + logvar(u_min,"u_min") + logvar(u_max,"u_max"));
576
577                int v_min = Math.max((int)Math.floor(y - r_d), 1);
578                int v_max = Math.min((int)Math.ceil(y + r_d), N - 2);
579                //              Debug(logvar(y,"y") + logvar(v_min,"v_min") + logvar(v_max,"v_max"));
580
581                // create the 3D orientation histogram, initialize to zero:
582                final int n_Spat = params.n_Spat;
583                final int n_Angl = params.n_Angl;
584                double[][][] h_grad = new double[n_Spat][n_Spat][n_Angl];
585                double[] gmo = new double[2];   // gradient magnitude/orientation
586
587                for (int u = u_min; u <= u_max; u++) {
588                        double dx = u - x;
589                        for (int v = v_min; v <= v_max; v++) {
590                                double dy = v - y;
591                                double r2 = sqr(dx) + sqr(dy);  // squared distance from center
592                                if (r2 < r_d2) {                                        // inside limiting circle
593                                        // map to the canonical coordinate frame, ii,jj \in [-1/2, +1/2]:
594                                        double uu = sc * (cos_phi_d * dx - sin_phi_d * dy);
595                                        double vv = sc * (sin_phi_d * dx + cos_phi_d * dy);
596                                        // calculate the gradient of Gaussian scale level (p,q) at position (u,v):
597                                        Gpq.getGradientPolar(u, v, gmo);
598                                        double E = gmo[0];                      // gradient magnitude
599                                        double phi = gmo[1];            // gradient orientation
600                                        double phi_norm = mod(phi - phi_d, PI2);// normalized gradient orientation      
601                                        double w_G = Math.exp(-r2/sigma_d2);    // Gaussian weight
602                                        double z = E * w_G;                                             // quantity to accumulate
603                                        updateGradientHistogram(h_grad, uu, vv, phi_norm, z);
604                                }
605                        }
606                }
607                int[] f_int = makeFeatureVector(h_grad);
608                double sigma_pq = G.getAbsoluteScale(p, q);
609                double x_real = G.getRealX(p, x);
610                double y_real = G.getRealY(p, y);
611                return new SiftDescriptor(x_real, y_real, sigma_pq, p, mag, phi_d, f_int);
612        }
613
614        private void updateGradientHistogram(double[][][] h_grad, double uu, double vv, double phi_norm, double z) {
615                final int n_Spat = params.n_Spat;
616                final int n_Angl = params.n_Angl;
617
618                final double ii = n_Spat * uu + 0.5 * (n_Spat - 1);     // continuous spatial histogram index i'
619                final double jj = n_Spat * vv + 0.5 * (n_Spat - 1);     // continuous spatial histogram index j'
620                final double kk = phi_norm * (n_Angl / PI2);            // continuous orientation histogram index k'
621
622                final int i0 = (int) Math.floor(ii);
623                final int i1 = i0 + 1;
624                
625                final int j0 = (int) Math.floor(jj);
626                final int j1 = j0 + 1;
627                
628                final int k0 = Math.floorMod((int) Math.floor(kk), n_Angl);
629                final int k1 = (k0 + 1) % n_Angl;                       // k0 >= 0
630                
631                final double alpha0 = 1.0 - (ii - i0);
632                final double alpha1 = 1.0 - alpha0;
633
634                final double beta0 = 1.0 - (jj - j0);
635                final double beta1 = 1.0 - beta0;
636
637                final double gamma0 = 1.0 - (kk - Math.floor(kk));
638                final double gamma1 = 1.0 - gamma0;
639
640                final int[] I = {i0, i1};       // index arrays used in loops below
641                final int[] J = {j0, j1};
642                final int[] K = {k0, k1};
643
644                final double[] A = {alpha0, alpha1};
645                final double[] B = {beta0, beta1};
646                final double[] C = {gamma0, gamma1};
647
648                // distribute z over 8 adjacent spatial/angular bins:
649                for (int a = 0; a <= 1; a++) {
650                        int i = I[a];
651                        if (i >= 0 && i < n_Spat) {
652                                double wa = A[a];
653                                for (int b = 0; b <= 1; b++) {
654                                        int j = J[b];
655                                        if (j >= 0 && j < n_Spat) {
656                                                double wb = B[b];
657                                                for (int c = 0; c <= 1; c++) {
658                                                        int k = K[c];
659                                                        double wc = C[c];
660                                                        h_grad[i][j][k] = h_grad[i][j][k] + z * wa * wb * wc;
661
662                                                }
663                                        }
664                                }
665                        }
666                }
667        }
668
669        private int[] makeFeatureVector(double[][][] h_grad) {
670                final int n_Spat = params.n_Spat;
671                final int n_Angl = params.n_Angl;
672                float[] f = new float[n_Spat * n_Spat * n_Angl];
673                // flatten 3D histogram to a 1D vector
674                // the histogram is vectorized such that k (phi) is the fastest
675                // varying index, followed by j and i (which is the slowest index).
676                // Note: j (v) is the slowest in VLFEAT (i,j swapped)
677                int m = 0;
678                for (int i = 0; i < n_Spat; i++) {
679                        for (int j = 0; j < n_Spat; j++) {
680                                for (int k = 0; k < n_Angl; k++) {
681                                        f[m] = (float) h_grad[i][j][k];
682                                        m = m + 1;
683                                }
684                        }
685                }
686                normalize(f);
687                clipPeaks(f, (float) params.t_Fclip);   
688                normalize(f);
689                return mapToIntegers(f, (float) params.s_Fscale);
690        }
691
692        private void normalize(float[] x) {
693                final double norm = Matrix.normL2(x);
694                if (norm > Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT) {
695                        final float s = (float) (1.0 / norm);
696                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
697                                x[i] = s * x[i];
698                        }
699                }
700        }
701
702        private void clipPeaks(float[] x, float xmax) {
703                for (int i=0; i<x.length; i++) {
704                        if (x[i] > xmax) {
705                                x[i] = xmax;
706                        }
707                }
708        }
709
710        private int[] mapToIntegers(float[] x, float s) {
711                int[] ivec = new int[x.length];
712                for (int i=0; i<x.length; i++) {
713                        ivec[i] = Math.round(s * x[i]);
714                }
715                return ivec;
716        }
717
718        //  auxiliary methods -------------------------
719
720        /*
721         * Calculate the extremal position from 3 discrete function values 
722         * at x = -1, 0, +1: f(-1) = 'y1', f(0) = 'y2', f(+1) = 'y3'.
723         */
724        private float interpolateQuadratic(float y1, float y2, float y3) {
725                float a = (y1 - 2*y2 + y3) / 2;
726                if (Math.abs(a) < 0.00001f) {
727                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("quadratic interpolation failed " 
728                                        + a + " " + y1 + " " + y2 + " " + y3);
729                }
730                float b = (y3 - y1) / 2;
731//              float c = y2;
732                float x_extrm = -b / (2*a);             // extremal position
733//              float y_extrm = a*x*x + b*x + c;        // extremal value (not needed)
734                return x_extrm; // x is in [-1,+1]
735        }
